## Some things that I think are neat üì∏

in no particular order

- [SMALL DATA](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eDr6_cMtfdA)
- [Data Trap](https://xkcd.com/2582/) - the comic above, by [xkcd](https://xkcd.com/)
- [freeasinweekend.org](https://freeasinweekend.org/) - ‚ÄúFree beer and free speech are all very well, but a free weekend? That's something worth paying for.‚Äù
- [0.30000000000000004.com](https://0.30000000000000004.com/)
- [rubber duck debugging](https://rubberduckdebugging.com/)
- [regex 101](https://regex101.com/) online regular expression parser
    - remember not to regex without [a license](https://regexlicensing.org/)
- [tmux terminal multiplexer](https://github.com/tmux/tmux/wiki) - do you have to work in the terminal a lot, keeping processes such as a jupyter notebook or local web server open? you might like tmux
- a list of [public api endpoints](https://github.com/public-apis/public-apis) to practice your programming or collect data for analysis
- [free programming books](https://ebookfoundation.github.io/free-programming-books/)
- [awesome-data](https://github.com/datasets/awesome-data) - a "curated list of quality open datasets"
- [Python Graph Gallery](https://python-graph-gallery.com/) - a website that displays "hundreds of charts made with Python" and code examples for how to make them
- [OSSU](https://github.com/ossu) - Open Source Society University: "Empowering learners to master college curricula through free resources."
- [project-based learning](https://github.com/practical-tutorials/project-based-learning)
- [advent of code](https://adventofcode.com/) - an advent calendar of programming problems every year since 2015
- [hanukkah of data](https://hanukkah.bluebird.sh/about/) - "Noah‚Äôs Rug is a set of short data challenges, first released in 2022 as Hanukkah of Data. The same fictional dataset is used for all puzzles. Explore this dataset with the tools of your choice to figure out the answers, light the Hanukkah candles, and find Noah‚Äôs missing rug."
- [spacetraders](https://spacetraders.io/) - a game played entirely via a web api
- [wezterm](https://wezfurlong.org/wezterm/) - a terminal emulator with config written in lua
